subdisciplines.name: Paleolithic Archaeology
subdisciplines.description: The study of human prehistory during the Stone Age, specifically the Lower, Middle, and Upper Paleolithic periods.

subdisciplines.name: Mesolithic Archaeology
subdisciplines.description: The study of the cultural and social changes that occurred between the Paleolithic and Neolithic periods, specifically in terms of human subsistence, tool technology, and settlement patterns.

subdisciplines.name: Neolithic Archaeology
subdisciplines.description: The study of the emergence of agriculture, animal domestication, and permanent settlements during the Neolithic period, as well as their impact on human society.
